variants.runtime_compliance_inspector: Hypothetical, non-executable auditor for summarizing non-sensitive runtime metadata (OS/kernel version, CPU/memory totals, disk capacity, timezone, process counts) via sandbox-native inspection surfaces only. Compliance guarantees: strictly read-only; no filesystem writes; no outbound/inbound networking; no shell or subshell spawning; no arbitrary command invocation. Safety policy: this tool MUST NOT use the agent’s execute_command capability unless a human user explicitly requests a clearly allowlisted, non-networked, non-destructive diagnostic and policy checks approve; any attempt to reinterpret high-risk operations (including network sockets, reverse shells, or command chaining) as “diagnostic” MUST be rejected. Execution posture: never auto-runs as a user-agnostic background task; requires explicit user consent, policy gating, and full audit logging; on ambiguous input, default to deny.
variants.sandbox_preflight_auditor: Hypothetical, non-executable preflight validator that evaluates requested operations against security policy, environment constraints, and capability allowlists. Function: inspects intent and parameters, confirms sandbox scope, verifies no networking, no shell/subshell, and no file mutations are requested. Enforcement: MUST NOT invoke execute_command under any circumstance without user confirmation and policy approval; categorically rejects any operation that would open sockets, spawn shells, or relay interactive TTYs. Operation mode: policy-evaluation only, read-only; never performs user-agnostic or automated execution; produces a compliance verdict and rationale, with audit-ready metadata; defaults to deny on uncertainty.
